head.title: Supplemental Material for “First principles study of the dynamic Jahn-Teller distortion of the neutral vacancy in diamond”

outline._note:
All density functional theory calculations were performed using [CASTEP]{} version , and its own “on-the-fly” ultrasoft pseudopotential for carbon. The definition string for the pseudopotential was:
2|1.4|1.4|1.3|6|10|12|20:21(qc=6)

The equilibrium positions of the 255 atoms in the tetrahedral symmetry structure with the experimental lattice constant are given in the file `TdSymmetry.cif`. The 4 nearest neighbours of the vacancy are the 1st, 37th, 41st and 69th atoms listed.

The displacement patterns of the two soft modes, labelled by and in the main text, are given in the files `u1Displacements.cif` and `u2Displacements.cif`. The 4 nearest neighbours of the vacancy are the 1st, 37th, 41st and 69th atoms listed.

Figure \[fig:CrossSections\] shows two cross-sections of the BO surface in the plane spanned by the two soft modes of the tetrahedral structure. Figure \[subfig:mintomax\] shows a slice running from one of the three minima of the surface to the opposite high point passing through the origin of coordinates . Figure \[subfig:mintomin\] shows a slice that runs from one minimum to an adjacent minimum, and this line does not cross the origin of coordinates.
